item.title: Nathanimal add a quote by Grace Paley
item.description: "The younger people with the ache of youth were eating all the cheese." -- Grace Paley

item.title: Nathanimal add a quote by Tatyana Tolstaya
item.description:
"...a book is a delicate friend, a white bird, an exquisite being, afraid of water.
Darling things! Afraid of water, of fire, They shiver in the wind. Clumsy, crude human fingers leave bruises on them that'll never fade! Never!
Some people touch books without washing their hands!
Some underline things in ink!
Some even tear pages out! " -- Tatyana Tolstaya

item.title: Nathanimal add a quote by Yevgeny Zamyatin
item.description: "Along the blade of a knife lies the path of paradoxâ€”the single most worthy path of the fearless mind . . . ." -- Yevgeny Zamyatin

item.title: Nathanimal add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "From the idea that the self is not given to us, I think there is only one practical consequence: we have to create ourselves as a work of art." -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Nathanimal add a quote by Joseph Cornell
Nathanimal add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "The sun shone, having no alternative, on the nothing new." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Nathanimal add a quote by Jane Bowles
item.description: "Even then she wore the look of certain fanatics who think of themselves as leaders without once having gained the respect of a single human being." -- Jane Bowles
